verses.verse: Keep silence<WH2790> before me<WH339>, O islands; and let the people<WH3816> renew<WH2498> their strength<WH3581>: let them come near<WH5066>; then let them speak<WH1696>: let us come near<WH7126> together<WH3162> to judgment<WH4941>.

Who raised up<WH5782> the righteous<WH6664> man from the east<WH4217>, called<WH7121> him to his foot<WH7272>, gave<WH5414> the nations<WH1471> before<WH6440> him<WH7287>, and made him rule over kings<WH4428>? he gave<WH5414> them as the dust<WH6083> to his sword<WH2719>, and as driven<WH5086> stubble<WH7179> to his bow<WH7198>.
He pursued<WH7291> them<WH5674>, and passed safely<WH7965>; even by the way<WH734> that he had not gone<WH935> with his feet<WH7272>.
Who has done<WH6466> and done<WH6213> it<WH7121>, calling the generations<WH1755> from the beginning<WH7218>? I the Lord<WH3068>, the first<WH7223>, and with the last<WH314>; I am he.
The islands<WH339> saw<WH7200> it<WH3372>, and feared; the ends<WH7098> of the earth<WH776> were afraid<WH2729>, drew near<WH7126>, and came<WH857>.
They helped<WH5826> every one<WH376> his neighbor<WH7453>; and every one said<WH559> to his brother<WH251>, Be of good courage<WH2388>.

So the carpenter<WH2796> encouraged<WH2388> the goldsmith<WH6884>, and he that smooths<WH2505> with the hammer<WH6360> him that struck<WH1986> the anvil<WH6471>, saying<WH559>, It is ready<WH2896> for the soldering<WH1694>: and he fastened<WH2388> it with nails<WH4548>, that it should not be moved<WH4131>.
But you<WH3478>, Israel, are my servant<WH5650>, Jacob<WH3290> whom I have chosen<WH977>, the seed<WH2233> of Abraham<WH85> my friend<WH157>.

You whom I have taken<WH2388> from the ends<WH7098> of the earth<WH776>, and called<WH7121> you from the chief men<WH678> there<WH559>, and said unto you<WH5650>, You are my servant; I have chosen<WH977> you<WH3988>, and not cast you away.

Fear<WH3372> you not<WH8159>; for I am with you: be not dismayed; for I am your God<WH430>: I will strengthen<WH553> you<WH5826>; Yes, I will help you<WH8551>; Yes, I will uphold you with the right hand<WH3225> of my righteousness<WH6664>.
Behold<WH2734>, all they that were incensed against you shall be ashamed<WH954> and confounded<WH3637>: they shall be as nothing<WH582>; and they that argue<WH7379> with you shall perish<WH6>.

You shall seek<WH1245> them<WH4672>, and shall not find them<WH582>, even them that contended<WH4695> with you<WH4421>: they that war against you shall be as nothing<WH657>, and as a thing of nothing.
For I the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> will hold<WH2388> your right hand<WH3225>, saying<WH559> unto you<WH3372>, Fear not<WH5826>; I will help you.

Fear<WH3372> not<WH8438>, you worm Jacob<WH3290>, and you men<WH4962> of Israel<WH3478>; I will help<WH5826> you<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH3068>, and your redeemer<WH1350>, the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>.

Behold<WH7760>, I will make you a new<WH2319> sharp<WH2742> threshing<WH4173> instrument having<WH1167> teeth<WH6374>: you shall thresh<WH1758> the mountains<WH2022>, and beat them small<WH1854>, and shall make<WH7760> the hills<WH1389> as chaff<WH4671>.

You shall fan<WH2219> them<WH7307>, and the wind shall carry them away<WH5375>, and the whirlwind<WH5591> shall scatter<WH6327> them<WH1523>: and you shall rejoice in the Lord<WH3068>, and shall glory<WH1984> in the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>.

When the poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34> seek<WH1245> water<WH4325>, and there is none<WH3956>, and their tongue fails<WH5405> for thirst<WH6772>, I the Lord<WH3068> will hear<WH6030> them<WH430>, I the God of Israel<WH3478> will not forsake them<WH5800>.

I will open<WH6605> rivers<WH5104> in high places<WH8205>, and fountains<WH4599> in the midst<WH8432> of the valleys<WH1237>: I will make<WH7760> the wilderness<WH4057> a pool<WH98> of water<WH4325>, and the dry<WH6723> land<WH776> springs<WH4161> of water<WH4325>.

I will plant<WH5414> in the wilderness<WH4057> the cedar<WH730>, the shittah tree<WH7848>, and the myrtle<WH1918>, and the oil<WH8081> tree<WH6086>; I will set<WH7760> in the desert<WH6160> the fir tree<WH1265>, and the pine<WH8410>, and the box tree<WH8391> together<WH3162>:

That they may see<WH7200>, and know<WH3045>, and consider<WH7760>, and understand<WH7919> together<WH3162>, that the hand<WH3027> of the Lord<WH3068> has done<WH6213> this<WH6918>, and the Holy One of Israel<WH3478> has created it<WH1254>.
Produce<WH7126> your cause<WH7379>, says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; bring forth<WH5066> your strong<WH6110> reasons<WH559>, says the King<WH4428> of Jacob<WH3290>.

Let them bring them forth<WH5066>, and show<WH5046> us what shall happen<WH7136>: let them show<WH5046> the former things<WH7223>, what they are<WH7760>, that we may consider them<WH3045>, and know the latter end<WH319> of them<WH8085>; or declare us things to come<WH935>.

Show<WH5046> the things that are to come<WH857> hereafter<WH268>, that we may know<WH3045> that you are gods<WH430>: Yes<WH3190>, do good, or do evil<WH7489>, that we may be dismayed<WH8159>, and behold<WH7200> it together<WH3162>.
Behold<WH369>, you are of nothing, and your work<WH6467> of nothing<WH659>: a abomination<WH8441> is he that chooses you<WH977>.

I have raised up<WH5782> one from the north<WH6828>, and he shall come<WH857>: from the rising<WH4217> of the sun<WH8121> shall he call<WH7121> upon my name<WH8034>: and he shall come<WH935> upon princes<WH5461> as upon mortar<WH2563>, and as the potter<WH3335> treads<WH7429> clay<WH2916>.

Who has declared<WH5046> from the beginning<WH7218>, that we may know<WH3045>? and previously<WH6440>, that we may say<WH559>, He is righteous<WH6662>? Yes<WH5046>, there is none that shows, Yes<WH8085>, there is none that declares, Yes<WH8085>, there is none that hears your words<WH561>.
The first<WH7223> shall say to Zion<WH6726>, Behold<WH2009>, behold<WH2009> them<WH5414>: and I will give to Jerusalem<WH3389> one that brings good news<WH1319>.
For I looked<WH7200>, and there was no man<WH376>; even among them<WH3289>, and there was no counselor, that<WH7592>, when I asked of them<WH7725>, could answer a word<WH1697>.
Behold<WH205>, they are all vanity; their works<WH4639> are nothing<WH657>: their molten images<WH5262> are wind<WH7307> and confusion<WH8414>.
